for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. who wasn't For six years, Larry Page and Sergey Brin told Eric Schmidt that Google Inc. should build its own browser, and for six years, he resisted. " Google Inc. was a small company," Eric Schmidt remembered. Having come through the bruising browser wars, I didn't want to do that again. So Sergey Brin and Page hired some ex-Firefox developers and had them build a prototype.
